page.title: 20SPORTS IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: fishing is mainly for sport with a rod and line. Some people go out in the boats and others fish off the sea wall and rocks. The fishermen use large rods called casters, or small thick rods with which they are more likely to catch bigger fish. Artificial baits such as rubber squids and eels are used together with feathers and live baits such as crab, ragworm and lugworm. Robin Hoods Bay is famous for its fried fish and chips. Because Robin Hoods Bay and Fylingthorpe are such small villages, many sports are not played. For instance we do not have a rugby team. The nearest swimming baths are in Whitby. The nearest sports centre is in Billingham, Teesside. Despite this Fylingdales is still a sporting area and will continue to be one for many, many years.
